wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Archer (died 1848) was an English actor and dramatist.

response: Thomas Archer (1668–1743) was English architect and courtier.
Thomas Archer may also refer to:
*Thomas Archer, 1st Baron Archer (1695–1768), English politician and nobleman
*Thomas Archer (MP) (fl. 1415–1417), English politician, Member of Parliament for the city Lincoln
*Thomas Archer (pastoralist) (1823–1905), Scottish-born Australian pioneer pastoralist and Agent General of Queensland

It premiered at the Theatre Royal, Drury Lane in London. The original cast starred William Macready as Tell and included Thomas Archer, Henry Gattie, Edward Knight, Elizabeth Yates, Clara Fisher, Charles Mayne Young and Margaret Agnes Bunn. Knowles dedicated the play to the Spanish opposition leader General Francisco Mina, then living in exile in England.
